citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
For the semi-annual evaluation conducted in September of 2024, there are no signatures to document the approval of the
report by a majority of the members of the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
Semi-annual evaluations are critical to program oversight, and IACUC member signatures are important to ensure that
members reviewed the semi-annual evaluation report and were in agreement with the findings, plan to address any
deficiencies, and had the opportunity to submit any minority views. The registrant must ensure that reports are reviewed
and signed by a majority of the IACUC members and must include any minority views, if applicable. In addition, the
reports shall be updated at least once every six months upon completion of the required semiannual evaluations and shall
be maintained by the research facility and made available to APHIS and to officials of funding Federal agencies for
inspection and copying upon request.
TO BE CORRECTED FROM THE DATE OF THIS INSPECTION ON 06/03/2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.31(c)(3) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
For the semi-annual evaluation conducted in September of 2024, there are no signatures to document the approval of the 
report by a majority of the members of the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).  
Semi-annual evaluations are critical to program oversight, and IACUC member signatures are important to ensure that 
members reviewed the semi-annual evaluation report and were in agreement with the findings, plan to address any 
deficiencies, and had the opportunity to submit any minority views. The registrant must ensure that reports are reviewed 
and signed by a majority of the IACUC members and must include any minority views, if applicable. In addition, the 
reports shall be updated at least once every six months upon completion of the required semiannual evaluations and shall 
be maintained by the research facility and made available to APHIS and to officials of funding Federal agencies for 
inspection and copying upon request. 
TO BE CORRECTED FROM THE DATE OF THIS INSPECTION ON 06/03/2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
